uk.co.edgeorgedev.notifj.notification.growl

Class GrowlNotification

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.edgeorgedev.notifj.notification.growl.GrowlNotification
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Notification
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OSXGrowlNotification, WindowsGrowlNotification

    public class GrowlNotification
extends java.lang.Object
implements Notification
    This class consists of methods to create Growl Notification messages that can be displayed on both Windows and Mac OS X

    The open() and show() methods of this class throw a NotificationException if the creation of a Growl Notification fails.

    It should also be noted that open() will throw a NotificationOperatingSystemException should it be called on a non-OSX operating system.

    Since:
    1.2
    Author:
    Ed George
    See Also:
    Notification, WindowsGrowlNotification, OSXGrowlNotification

    • Constructor Detail

      • GrowlNotification

        public GrowlNotification(java.lang.String application_name)
                  throws NotificationException
        Constructs an unregistered named Growl notification application

        The registration process occurs within the open() method.

        This class creates notifications that can be viewed by Growl for OSX and Growl for Windows (GFW)

        Throws:
        NotificationException
        Since:
        1.2

      • sticky

        public GrowlNotification sticky()
        Enables any subsequent notifications to be sticky by being displayed until dismissed

        Notifications created by GrowlNotification are non-sticky by default

      • sticky

        public GrowlNotification sticky(boolean sticky)
        Enables/Disables any subsequent notifications to be sticky by being displayed until dismissed
        Specified by:
        sticky in interface Notification
        Parameters:
        sticky - true if sticky Growl Notifications are to be enabled and false otherwise.

      • callbackUrl

        public GrowlNotification callbackUrl(java.net.URL callback_url)
        Adds a callback url to notifications.

        When a Growl notification is clicked, this URL will be opened by the system's default browser

        Specified by:
        callbackUrl in interface Notification
        Parameters:
        callback_url - the callback URL to open - null can be used to remove the callback as can removeCallback()
        Returns:
        the modified GrowlNotification object
        Since:
        1.2
        See Also:
        removeCallback()
